title: (x) 'GW' Hallmark letters - Capitals (modified) {Yves, Mark S}
content:
These are used on a whisky label, any help would be appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitled-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202131111/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_49.jpg) | 31.7 KB |
author: byngo

comments.content: Was there ever a bold version designed of the Apple Macintosh system font [Capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202131111/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/capitals/)?
Maybe it's Capitals with a stroke applied? Stretched a bit too?

I'd guess it's the lower case of [Capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202131111/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/capitals/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D57%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DGW%2520gw%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3D%26seed%3D22) with a stroke applied.

- Mike Yanega

Looks like Mark is exactly right: It's Capitals (but the UC; in the lc the proportions of the "G" are different), stretched horizontally and with a stroke added.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202131111im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gw_6054.gif)
